# Introduction {.unnumbered}

This website contains an evolving thematic catalogue of František Ignác Antonín Tůma's works.

::: {.callout-important}
## Caution

This catalogue is **work-in-progress** and likely contains errors or duplicate entries. Its contents are subject to change as we screen more and more manuscripts. A [development version](https://dev.frantisek-tuma.at/) is available.
:::

For general and biographical information on Werner, see @Postolka2001, @Slavicky2004, @Slavicky2006, and @Schmid1901.


## Overview

We classify Tůma's works as *Vocal music* (groups A to H) and *instrumental music* (groups I to L). Groups C, D, and E are further divided into subgroups to provide a more fine-grained classification and to preserve work numbering if further works are discovered. Following works with ascertained authorship, lost works (prefix L followed by consecutive number) and spurious and uncertain attributions (prefix S followed by consecutive number) are included.

**Vocal music** comprises

- *A. Masses*<br/>
- *B. Requiems*
- *C. Short liturgical works*<br/>
  (1) Graduals<br/>
  (2) Hymns<br/>
  (3) Motets<br/>
  (4) Offertories<br/>
  (5) Responsories<br/>
  (6) Miscellaneous
- *D. Vespers and psalms*<br/>
  (1) Complete vespers<br/>
  (2) Psalms<br/>
  (3) Misereres<br/>
  (4) Canticles
- *E. Marian antiphons*<br/>
  (1) Alma Redemptoris mater<br/>
  (2) Ave Regina coelorum<br/>
  (3) Regina coeli<br/>
  (4) Salve Regina<br/>
  (5) Sub tuum praesidium
- *F. Sequences*
- *G. Litanies*
- *H. Miscellaneous vocal works*

**Instrumental music** comprises

- *I. Sonatas*
- *J. Sinfonias*
- *K. Partitas*
- *L. Miscellaneous instrumental works*

The catalogue contains at least the following information for each work:

- title
- one or more incipits
- identifiers in other catalogues
- [Archival Resource Key](#arks)
- sources (linked to the respective RISM entry, if available)
- miscellaneous notes
- relevant literature
- modern editions [@Bartos2018, p. 89ff]

In addition, we are annotating more and more works with [detailed metadata](metadata.qmd) in MEI format [@MEI2023].

Works in the catalogue should be cited by the abbreviation “TumW”, followed by the group, subgroup (if applicable), and work number; the latter three components should be separated by a period.

As a supplement to the catalogue, we publish selected works as [Open Content editions](https://edition.esser-skala.at/scores/frantisek-ignac-antonin-tuma/). Available works are marked with the symbol ![](images/ees_link_light.svg) in the work details.

## Methods

### Sources

We consulted the following sources, of which some contain partial catalogues of Werner's works:

- @Ball1900 – works known around 1900
- @Eitner1903 [p. 471f] – sources known around 1900
- @Klinka1975 – vocal works, including practical editions of several motets
- @Peschek1956 – masses known in the 1950s
- @Reichert1935 – masses known in the 1930s
- @Vogg1951 – works known around 1950

### Workflow

The work list assembled from these sources (`data/catalogue_works.csv`) was checked against and supplemented by RISM entries. To this end, entries were downloaded via [*sru-downloader*](https://github.com/rism-international/sru-downloader) on 2024-05-26, yielding 309 entries. In the resulting XML file, all tags in the `zs` namespace were removed, yielding the XML file `data/rism_entries.xml`, which only contains [MarcXML](https://www.loc.gov/standards/marcxml/) tags:

```bash
java -jar SRUDownloader.jar "https://muscat.rism.info/sru/sources?operation=searchRetrieve&version=1.1&query=creator=%22T%C5%AFma,+Franti%C5%A1ek+Ign%C3%A1c%22&maximumRecords=100"
grep -v "<zs:" output.xml | \
  grep -v "</zs:" | \
  grep -v "<marc:collection" | \
  grep -v "</marc:collection" | \
  sed '1 a\<marc:collection xmlns:marc="http://www.loc.gov/MARC21/slim">' | \
  sed '$ a\</marc:collection>' \
  > rism_entries.xml
rm output.xml
```

Later changes in the RISM database were manually added to the catalogue (2025-05-18: 332 entries for “Tůma, František Ignác” and 4 entries for “Tůma”). Pages for all groups of works were generated automatically from `catalogue_overview.csv` and `catalogue_works.csv`. If manually curated incipits were unavailable for a work, the first incipit of the first source with a RISM entry was included. Data from the [RISM Catalogue](https://opac.rism.info) (e.g., Plaine & Easie Code for incipits) by the *Répertoire International des Sources Musicales* is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution CC-BY 3.0 Unported License.

Detailed work metadata was edited with [MerMEId v2.0](https://mermeid.edirom.de/). Incipits were either prepared with [MuseScore](https://musescore.org), polished with [mei-friend](https://mei-friend.mdw.ac.at), and rendered with [Verovio](https://www.verovio.org), or created with [LilyPond](https://lilypond.org/) and [EES Tools](https://github.com/edition-esser-skala/ees-tools). XML files were exported from MerMEId, post-processed and validated against the schema [mei-CMN](https://github.com/music-encoding/schema/blob/main/4.0.0/mei-CMN.rng). These pages are rendered using the [BravuraText](https://github.com/steinbergmedia/bravura) font v1.392 and Verovio.

The technical workflow has been presented as a [poster](/publications/poster_iaml_2025.pdf) at the IAML Conference 2025 in Salzburg.


### ARKs

A semi-opaque Archival Resource Key ([ARK](https://arks.org)) is assigned to each work as persistent identifier:

- Each ARK uses the Name Assigning Authority Number ([NAAN](https://arks.org/about/ark-naans-and-systems/)) `68748` …
 - … and the [Shoulder](https://arks.org/about/ark-features/) `ft1`.
 - The [Blade](https://arks.org/specs/) consists of the catalogue of work number (lowercase, no separators).

Thus, the ARKs [ark:68748/ft1a1](https://n2t.net/ark:68748/ft1a1) and [ark:68748/ft1c313](https://n2t.net/ark:68748/ft1c313) denote TumW A.1 and C.3.13, respectively.

ARKs are resolved by `https://ark.esser-skala.at` via a [minimal ARK resolver](https://github.com/edition-esser-skala/minimal-ark-resolver). (They are also forwarded to the resolver from this site's base URL via its `.htaccess` file.) The resolver supports the following features:

- The object variant `.mei` directly resolves to the metadata in MEI format.<br/>
Example: [ark:68748/ft1a9.mei](https://n2t.net/ark:68748/ft1a9.mei)
- The object variant `score` directly resolves to the full score.<br/>
Example: [ark:68748/ft1a9.score](https://n2t.net/ark:68748/ft1a9.score)
- The inflection `?info` yields a brief metadata record following the [Dublin Kernel](https://www.dublincore.org/groups/kernel/spec/) specification, including a persistence statement using the [NLM vocabulary](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/pubs/techbull/ma05/ma05_archive.html).<br/>
Examples: [ark:68748/ft1a9?info](https://n2t.net/ark:68748/ft1a9?info) and [ark:68748/ft1a9.mei?info](https://n2t.net/ark:68748/ft1a9.mei?info)



### Data and code availability

Datasets and code used for preparing this catalogue are available from [GitHub](https://github.com/edition-esser-skala/tuma-catalogue-of-works).
